summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report of LANCE CALLOWAY, a former chef and island manager for Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on September 10, 2020. CALLOWAY describes his employment from approximately 2006 to early 2009, his observations at Epstein's New York residence and private island, and his awareness of the investigation into Epstein.

persons.name: Lance Calloway
persons.role: Former Chef and Island Manager for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about his employment with Jeffrey Epstein from approximately winter 2006 to January/February 2009. Describes his duties, observations at Epstein's properties, and his eventual departure.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: CALLOWAY's employer. Described as having many visitors, including young females, and taking a girl to his bedroom on the island approximately every hour. Was polite to CALLOWAY but became upset when CALLOWAY quit.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Met CALLOWAY at her house, interviewed him, and yelled at him once. She would travel to the island and text CALLOWAY instructions.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who told CALLOWAY not to accept anything from anyone because he could be getting served. CALLOWAY would go to him for big purchases.

persons.name: Igor
persons.context: Described as very friendly, mostly stayed in the gym at the New York City residence. CALLOWAY spent a lot of time with him.

persons.name: Jojo
persons.context: Driver for Epstein. Would drive Epstein to his office and, along with another staff member, would take care of guests. May have told CALLOWAY to stay out of sight.

persons.name: Lyn
persons.context: Maid at Epstein's New York residence. CALLOWAY would leave prepared meals for her and the driver.

persons.name: Richard
persons.context: Property manager at Epstein's New York residence. CALLOWAY would not hang out in the front with him.

persons.name: Cathy
persons.context: Former chef on Epstein's island whom CALLOWAY replaced. She and MILES ALEXANDER returned to South Africa. May have told CALLOWAY why Epstein was being investigated and to stay out of sight.

persons.name: Miles Alexander
persons.context: Former staff on Epstein's island who returned to South Africa with CATHY. May have told CALLOWAY about the investigation into Epstein.

persons.name: Adam Perry Lane
persons.context: Used to be a chef for Epstein before CALLOWAY.

persons.name: Brice
persons.context: Oversaw house managers and took over the island after CALLOWAY left. May have come to the island to explain the investigation to staff. CALLOWAY gave his notice to him.

connections.description: CALLOWAY was employed by Epstein as a chef and later island manager from approximately 2006 to 2009.
MAXWELL interviewed CALLOWAY for the job, gave him instructions, and yelled at him once. He did one dinner for her at her house.
INDYKE, Epstein's attorney, gave CALLOWAY instructions regarding legal service and was a point of contact for large purchases.
MAXWELL was involved in hiring staff for Epstein and traveled to his island. Implied close association in operations.
CALLOWAY spent a lot of time with IGOR, the bodyguard/personal trainer, at the New York residence.
CALLOWAY replaced CATHY as chef on Epstein's island. She may have informed him about the investigation and house rules.

events.title: Lance Calloway Begins Employment
events.description: LANCE CALLOWAY begins working for Jeffrey Epstein as a chef, hired through a headhunter after interviews with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Calloway Learns of Investigation
events.description: Approximately three-fourths of the way through his employment (around 2008), CALLOWAY learns there is an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Calloway Resigns
events.description: CALLOWAY gives his notice to BRICE and leaves Epstein's employment in January or February 2009, while Epstein is in jail. Epstein calls him upset.

events.title: FBI Interview of Lance Calloway
events.description: The FBI interviews LANCE CALLOWAY via video conference regarding his employment with Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York residence)
West Palm Beach, Florida (mentioned as a location CALLOWAY never visited)
keyFacts: Lance Calloway observed that at Epstein's island, 'about every hour EPSTEIN would take a girl down to his master bedroom. After his massage the maids would go down and make the bed and clean up.'
Calloway stated it was an 'unwritten rule' for staff to stay out of sight and to take care of Epstein and Maxwell.
Calloway described many young female visitors (looking 18 or early 20s) at Epstein's New York residence, though he had no interaction with them.
Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, warned Calloway not to accept anything from anyone because 'he could be getting served,' indicating awareness of legal proceedings.
Calloway left his job in early 2009 after finding new employment in New Jersey while Epstein was in jail, and was told to leave the island immediately after giving notice.
